title: Tour de France: Biniam Girmay is leading a revolution in cycling
description: The small nation of Eritrea is on the verge of breaking through in elite cycling - and Biniam Girmay is at the centre of it.

title: ChatGPT owner in probe over risks around false answers
description: US regulators are asking the maker of ChatGPT about protections for privacy and reputational risk.

title: West Mersea: 'Hero' dad saved his son but drowned
description: A woman is collecting donations for the lifeboat crew who tried to save her partner's life

title: Public sector pay: Will the new offer stop the strikes?
description: The government has accept the recommendations of the pay review bodies, but will the workers?

title: Pig tempted out of ditch with Turkish delight
description: Firefighters tried using slings but it was Boris' favourite snack that did the trick.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Novak Djokovic meets Jannik Sinner, Carlos Alcaraz faces Daniil Medvedev
description: Novak Djokovic believes his formidable Wimbledon record means he is the favourite to win the men's title going into Friday's semi-finals.

title: Which movies and TV shows are impacted by the Hollywood strike?
description: This is how a mega-strike involving writers and performers may see film and TV productions put on ice.

title: Stars leave Oppenheimer premiere as Hollywood actors' strike called
description: Cillian Murphy and Emily Blunt leave Oppenheimer premiere as Hollywood actors join major strike.

title: Wimbledon 2023 results: Britain's Neal Skupski and Dutch partner Wesley Koolhof into doubles final
description: Britain's Neal Skupski says winning Wimbledon would be the "holy grail" after reaching the men's doubles final with Dutch partner Wesley Koolhof.

title: Men and boys charged over clashes Knowsley asylum hotel
description: Three boys aged 13, 16 and 17, and two men, aged 38 and 60, have been charged with violent disorder.

title: Christian Pulisic: Chelsea forward completes £20m AC Milan switch
description: United States forward Christian Pulisic completes his £20m move from Chelsea to AC Milan.

title: New wave of strikes on way, Unite leader Sharon Graham warns
description: Strikes will continue unless ministers and big firms increase their pay offers, Ms Graham warns.

title: Teacher strikes likely to end in England after pay offer
description: Union leaders have come out in support of a new 6.5% pay offer and will recommend members accept it.

title: Drone shows great white sharks swimming under surfers
description: A handful of sharks lurked below the surface while surfers caught waves in California.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Ons Jabeur plays best shot of day 11
description: Watch the best shots on day 11 featuring Ons Jabeur, Ranah Akua Stoiber, Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid at Wimbledon.

title: Hollywood actors' strike expected alongside screenwriters
description: The SAG-AFTRA union is expected to opt for strike action on Thursday, after studio talks broke down.

title: Dubai cash mules who smuggled millions in suitcases sentenced
description: They were part of a wider scheme which saw £104m leave the UK in flights from London, the NCA says.

title: White House cocaine: US Secret Service ends investigation
description: The cocaine was discovered earlier this month in a vestibule in the White House.

title: Taylor Swift tickets: Viagogo boss defends resale site
description: There's been anger at Eras tour tickets being resold on the secondary site for thousands of pounds.

title: Using agency staff to cover strikes ruled unlawful
description: Bosses can no longer use agency staff to cover striking workers during walkouts, the High Court rules.

title: COP28: Admit your failures, climate summit host Al Jaber tells nations
description: Campaigners welcomed a 'new vision' from the UN climate summit host who is also a UAE oil boss.

title: Tour de France: Ion Izagirre cruises to stage 12 win as Jonas Vingegaard retains lead
description: Ion Izagirre cruises to victory on stage 12 to end a seven-year wait since his last stage win at the Tour de France.

title: Wimbledon 2023: 'Unbelievable' shot from Ons Jabeur to win point against Aryna Sabalenka
description: Watch an unbelievable shot from Ons Jabeur to win a point against Aryna Sabalenka in their semi-final match at Wimbledon.

title: Ronan Kanda: Teens sentenced for boy's mistaken identity murder
description: Ronan Kanda, 16, had been buying a PlayStation controller when he was stabbed close to his home.

title: Wennington wildfire probably started in back garden - report
description: Seventeen houses were damaged in east London during a heatwave last year.

title: Ming vase used as £8.50 doorstop in Essex sells for £3,400
description: The object, believed to be from the Chinese Ming Dynasty, sells after being found in a charity shop.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Marketa Vondrousova beats Elina Svitolina to makes women's singles final
description: Watch highlights as Marketa Vondrousova makes history, becoming the first unseeded player to reach a Wimbledon women's singles final in the Open era after beating Elina Svitolina 6-3 6-3.

title: Kevin Spacey: Touch was romantic, says actor as he denies assault
description: The two-time Oscar-winning actor denies sex offences between 2001 and 2013.

title: Nottingham attacks: Foundations to be set up for student victims
description: The families of Grace O'Malley-Kumar and Barnaby Webber want to fundraise in their memory.

title: Dalbeattie farmer died after attack by cow with her calf
description: An inquiry finds no precautions could have avoided Derek Roan's death on his farm near Dalbeattie.

title: Kosovo: Drink thrown as brawl breaks out in Kosovo parliament
description: An opposition lawmaker douses PM Albin Kurti during a parliamentary debate sparking a brief fight.

description: Rory McIlroy delivers a damning response to the short-lived prospect of being offered ownership of a LIV Golf team franchise.

title: Wimbledon 2023 results: Elina Svitolina loses to Marketa Vondrousova in semi-finals
description: Czech Marketa Vondrousova becomes the first unseeded player to reach a Wimbledon women's final after ending Elina Svitolina's inspired run.

title: In pictures: International karate tournament back in Dundee

title: Chinese spies penetrated 'every sector' of UK, ISC report warns
description: A damning new report says the UK government has "no strategy on China, let alone an effective one".

title: Wimbledon 2023: Great Britain's Ranah Akua Stoiber wins exciting rally
description: Watch Great Britain youngster Ranah Akua Stoiber win an exciting rally against Nikola Bartunkova at Wimbledon.

title: Ministers could be fined for breaching lobbying rules under Labour
description: The party says it will create a new watchdog with powers to propose sanctions against ministers.

title: Where has the summer gone?
description: Flaming June has given way to a mixed July. It’s just the latest chapter in a year of big weather changes.

title: Sudan conflict: 87 people found in Darfur mass grave, UN says
description: There are concerns the RSF is targeting specific ethnic groups in the West Darfur region.

title: Millions of public sector workers to get pay rise
description: Millions of public sector workers, including teachers and police, are to get pay rises between 5-7%.

title: BBC resumes Huw Edwards inquiry as no criminality found by police
description: Police say no evidence of criminal behaviour over claims he paid a young person for explicit photos.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Jamie Murray on missing another title chance at All England Club
description: In his BBC Sport column at Wimbledon, British doubles star Jamie Murray talks about losing another opportunity to achieve his biggest career goal.

title: In pictures: Cerberus heatwave hits parts of Europe
description: People in countries including Italy and Spain are struggling to cope with soaring temperatures.

title: Warning public debt could soar as population ages
description: Debt could rise to more than 300% of the size of the economy by 2070, the government's forecaster says.

title: Mark Cavendish says he is all good' after surgery on broken collarbone
description: Mark Cavendish says it will take "a few weeks" to recover after having surgery on a broken collarbone that ended his Tour de France.

title: Tube strike: More London Underground staff to join walkout
description: Hundreds of members of the Unite union are set to take action on 26 and 28 July.

title: Champions Cup: La Rochelle to host Leinster in opener as fixtures confirmed
description: Back-to-back Champions Cup winners La Rochelle meet Leinster in a rematch of the past two finals in their opening 2023-24 pool fixture.

title: Dele Alli: Everton midfielder says he was sexually abused aged six
description: Everton midfielder Dele Alli says he was sexually abused when he was six years old and started dealing drugs aged eight.

title: Barbie movie: How the marketing campaign has got everyone talking

title: Virgin Media investigated by Ofcom over contract cancelling issues
description: Ofcom says it will open an investigation after customers said it was too difficult to cancel services.

title: Netball World Cup 2023: BBC to show matches from second stage onwards across all platforms
description: The BBC will show the 2023 Netball World Cup in South Africa across its broadcast platforms from the second group stage onwards.

title: Ukraine war: Russian general fired after criticising army leaders
description: Gen Ivan Popov says he refused to keep quiet over issues at the front line in Ukraine.

description: With a host of big-name players signed up, and backed by wealthy investors, cricket in the USA may finally be given lift-off by a new T20 competition.

title: Feeling the 'Kenergy' on Barbie movie pink carpet
description: Stars from the hotly-anticipated film attend its premiere in London's Leicester Square.

title: Pandemic puppy boom illegal practices persist, say vets
description: The Royal Veterinary College says illegal acts, like puppies only viewed online pre-purchase, have persisted post-pandemic.

title: UK economy hit by extra bank holiday in May
description: The economy shrank by 0.1% in May, partly down to the extra bank holiday for the King's Coronation.

title: Women's World Cup: How 'fiery' Chloe Kelly became England star

title: Microsoft-Activision: US regulator to appeal against $69bn gaming deal ruling

title: Ukraine war: One killed in overnight Kyiv drone attack
description: A third consecutive night of strikes on Kyiv comes hours after the Nato summit.

title: 'I was on a mission to stop this man'

title: Watch: Drone shows large chunks of highway destroyed in India floods

title: Migration Bill: Lords reinsert child detention limits

title: Danish vlogger: 'My guilt over being traded in Iranian prisoner swap'
